1.text: After this Job opened his mouth, and cursed the day of his birth.

3.text: “Let the day perish in which I was born, the night which said, ‘There is a boy conceived.’

4.text: Let that day be darkness. Don’t let God from above seek for it, neither let the light shine on it.

5.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own. Let a cloud dwell on it. Let all that makes black the day terrify it.

6.text: As for that night, let thick darkness seize on it. Let it not rejoice among the days of the year. Let it not come into the number of the months.

7.text: Behold, let that night be barren. Let no joyful voice come therein.

8.text: Let them curse it who curse the day, who are ready to rouse up leviathan.

9.text: Let the stars of its twilight be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,

10.text: because it didn’t shut up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor did it hide trouble from my eyes.

11.text: “Why didn’t I die from the womb? Why didn’t I give up the spirit when my mother bore me?

12.text: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should nurse?

13.text: For now should I have lain down and been quiet. I should have slept, then I would have been at rest,

14.text: with kings and counselors of the earth, who built up waste places for themselves;

15.text: or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

16.text: or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, as infants who never saw light.

17.text: There the wicked cease from troubling. There the weary are at rest.

18.text: There the prisoners are at ease together. They don’t hear the voice of the taskmaster.

19.text: The small and the great are there. The servant is free from his master.

20.text: “Why is light given to him who is in misery, life to the bitter in soul,

21.text: Who long for death, but it doesn’t come; and dig for it more than for hidden treasures,

22.text: who rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

23.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, whom God has hedged in?

24.text: For my sighing comes before I eat. My groanings are poured out like water.

25.text: For the thing which I fear comes on me, That which I am afraid of comes to me.

26.text: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; but trouble comes.”
